meanings.sent1: The revictualling ship arrived just in time to replenish our food supplies.
meanings.sent2: The revictualling team ensured that the soldiers had enough food for the long journey.
meanings.sent3: The revictualling picnic was a hit with all the delicious snacks and treats.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a revictualling ray of sunshine on a gloomy day.
meanings.sent5: The revictualling efforts made sure no one went hungry during the camping trip.

meanings.definition: To provide with fresh supplies of food or provisions
meanings.sent1: The army was revictualling their base before the next mission.
meanings.sent2: The chef was revictualling the kitchen with fresh ingredients for the evening rush.
meanings.sent3: She revictualled her backpack with snacks before heading out on the hike.
meanings.sent4: The farmer revictualled the barn with hay for the winter months.
meanings.sent5: The store was revictualling its shelves with new products for the holiday season.
